name: Season's Baseball Oddities Quiz | MLB by Season | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which batter actually swung at a pitch that hit him?
questions.explanation:
Jose Canseco.

	That could only happen to Jose Canseco. My source for all of these questions come from ESPN.com.

questions.text: Which team hit 3 sacrifice flies in an inning twice during the 2000 season?
questions.explanation:
Yankees.

	The first time on June 29 made possible when Bobby Higginson of Detroit dropped a fly ball and then again made possible when Ron Gant of Anaheim dropped a fly ball on August 19.

questions.text: Which player in a single game made the third out in the first, second and the third innings?
questions.explanation:
Juan Gonzalez.

	Juan did this feat on September 13th against the White Sox.

questions.text: After the 1999 season, the Tigers and Rangers made a blockbuster deal involving nine players. What happened during the first meeting of 2000 between these two teams?
questions.correct: None of the nine players played
options: All the runs were scored by players involved in the trade
The winning and losing pitchers were involved in the trade
questions.explanation: None of the nine players played.

questions.text: On May 18th, the Florida Marlins lost a game to San Diego even though they accomplished this feat?
Which player became only the fourth player in history to play all nine positions in one game?
questions.explanation:
Scott Sheldon.

	Scott Sheldon of the Texas Rangers did this on September 6th against Chicago White Sox.

questions.text: Which team out-homered the Boston Red Sox 14-0 in games played at Fenway Park in 2000?
Which pitcher in the span of four days blew one save without throwing a pitch (balk) then blew a save on his first pitch which tied the game and then on the next pitch lost the game?
questions.explanation:
Jason Isringhausen.

	The span was from August 5th to the 8th.

questions.text: What happened to Charlie Manuel during his first 3 games as a rookie manager for the Cleveland Indians?
questions.correct: He was ejected in two of them
options: He had his pitcher in the lineup instead of the designated hitter
He sat in the wrong dugout
questions.explanation: He was ejected in two of them.
